page.title: 17BROCKHAMPTON SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: We visited a Sewage Works or Farm.It is owned by the Severn Trent Water Authority.It serves the Southam/ Wood- mancote area.The Works treats domestic sewage waste and industrial waste from Smiths Industry.The Works deals with 1,000,000 gallons of sewage a day,which is taken into the Works by Archimedes Screw.There are 4 but only 1 is used on an average day.The sewage is cleaned by settlement tanks , sprayers and biological coke bed filters.Only 2 people work there.Sometimes they have to unblock and mend the Treatment Works. The Works also deals with surface rain water.But in a storm flooding doesn't cause any problems because storm tanks hold the extra water. The Authority owns another property in the area,a small sewage treatment works near Stoke Orchard.
